title: Imprisoner Of Magic
opening: With Uhai's dying words still sounding in their ears, they venture deep into the forest's heart. Lyn moves in utmost silence, cautious not to alert any hidden enemy. However, following on her path, a new Black Fang shadow appears.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: A great, rotted tree... This would appear to be the place of which Uhai spoke.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: So if we move west from here, we’ll reach the Dragon’s Gate, right?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: OK, let’s go!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hector, hold a moment.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Walk quietly. Your armor is too noisy.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Oh! ... How’s this?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You’re still clanking.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Do you see what I’m wearing? This equipment is not light! How do you propose I walk quietly in this!?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Stop yelling at me! It’s because of that clattering armor you’re wearing! I’m just saying we have to move cautiously. Nothing more!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I know! And I’m saying that I’m doing my best!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Quiet, both of you! Armor or no, if you two keep shouting like that, every enemy from here to Pherae itself will hear us!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Ah...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Sorry.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: We must proceed with caution.  I can’t believe Uhai was the only Black Fang in these woods.

intro.speaker: Black Fang
intro.line: Lord Aion, we’ve received word from the pegasus unit. Targets are approaching from the far side of that mountain to the east.

intro.speaker: Aion
intro.line: Hmph... Uhai must have failed after all. I’m not surprised. We’re talking about the shallow wisdom of a Sacaen nomad, after all. He possessed a certain rough talent, but no mind for planning. Our units are in place, are they not?

intro.speaker: Black Fang
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Aion
intro.line: Ha ha... Good. Very good. In confined spaces like this, my thunder magic devastates. The battle has already been won... I cannot lose. Combat is an equation. Those with intelligence have a natural advantage. Those imbeciles will not reach the Dragon’s Gate. Never. I will bury them here in this forest!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I can see ruins. Is that the Dragon’s Gate?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Ninian? Are you all right?

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: ...Beware! ......The enemy comes!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Enemy?

intro.speaker: Shaman
intro.line: Eliwood of Pherae! Prepare yourself!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Oof!! We won’t reach the Dragon’s Gate if we stay on the defensive. Hit their commander, and attack the ruins!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Eliwood. Is their commander the one in the ruins?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I think so. It must be him.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Looks like he’s a pretty solid magic user. Bah, I’m still not confident against mages and their ilk.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Is that so, Hector? Perhaps you should hold back a little then.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: What nonsense is that? I can’t fight from the rear!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: No, I just meant that sometimes it’s advantageous to...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Why waste good breath on words when there’s fighting to be done! C’mon!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: H-Hey! Hector!! ...Why do I even try?!

battle.speaker: Fiora
battle.line: Honored tactician... Your name is Mark, correct? The enemy commander is readying his troops beyond that mountain. I can fly over the mountain and direct you, but... Getting too close could prove to be dangerous. Bear that in mind when you give me my orders.

battle.speaker: Aion
battle.line: Wha-What?! The magic power of this place... The source is...distorted... I...I can’t use any of my magic!

battle.speaker: Black Fang
battle.line: Lord Aion! Disaster! A magic seal!

battle.speaker: Aion
battle.line: A magic– That good-for-nothing has shown his face?! Curses... I’d not forseen this!!

visit.speaker: Eliwood
visit.line: Who is it? What are you doing there!?

visit.speaker: Renault
visit.line: I’m Renault. I’m on a pilgrimage.

visit.speaker: Renault
visit.line: What are you doing here? You don’t appear to be with the black-robed group I saw earlier.

visit.speaker: Eliwood
visit.line: No, we stand opposed to them. ...This is a battleground. You should stay here, Your Excellency. This battle is nothing that need concern you.

visit.speaker: Renault
visit.line: I’m sure that I cannot convince you to lay down your arms. That being the case, I give you this.

visit.speaker: Renault
visit.line: It may help you live longer. Even if you face the misery of defeat in combat, you might yet find another road if you but live.

visit.speaker: Renault
visit.line: May you be watched over and protected in your venture.

visit.speaker: Eliwood
visit.line: Thank you. You as well, Your Excellency.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Eliwood, I’m sorry. I said things I shouldn’t have.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: No, I was shouting without thinking. I was wrong. Forgive me.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: No, it was my fault. If I hadn’t...

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: It’s no one’s fault. There’s an eerie power here.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I don’t feel it any longer, but... It was meant to make us uneasy. Was it connected to that area where magic was nullified?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Now that you mention it, I was so irritable... I couldn’t let even the smallest thing go by without complaining. ...What could that have been? The Black Fang couldn’t use magic either. So it wasn’t an ally of theirs...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: It’s gone now, so no sense in worrying about it. We should concentrate on pushing forward.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hmm. Let’s make haste to the Dragon’s Gate.
